Articles for You

Located below are some helpful articles to get you motivated and prepared for your next athletic season. Check back every week for new materials and resources!

  • “If you fail to prepare, you’re prepared to fail.” – Mark Spitz
    • Why Sports Are Great for Team Building.
    • Helpful Tips for Exercising You Didn't Know About!
    • Have You Had Water Today?


Tennis

Game, Set, Match!

Designed and codified in England in the 1870s, it is the direct descendant of jeu de paume, invented in France in the 11th century.

  • "Life is like a game of tennis; the player who serves well seldom loses." ― Author Unknown
    • Maria Sharapova
    • Serena Williams
    • Rafael Nadal


Basketball

He Shoots. He Scores!

The only major sport strictly of U.S. origin, basketball was invented by James Naismith (1861–1939) on or about December 1, 1891, at the International Young Men’s Christian Association (YMCA) Training School (now Springfield College), Springfield, Massachusetts, where Naismith was an instructor in physical education.

  • “Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there.” ― John Wooden
    • Stephen Curry
    • Giannis Antetokounmpo
    • Luka Dončić


Soccer

GOAAAAAL

Although the game of soccer has been around for more than 2,000 years, soccer as we know it today is traced back to England. The game was once played in ancient China, Greece, Rome, and Japan but with different rules and variations.

  • "Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do." – Pele
    • Pelé
    • Lionel Messi
    • Cristiano Ronaldo


Swimming

Just Keep Swimming.

Archaeological and other evidence shows swimming to have been practiced as early as 2500 bce in Egypt and thereafter in Assyrian, Greek, and Roman civilizations. In Greece and Rome swimming was a part of martial training and was, with the alphabet, also part of elementary education for males

  • "Only when the tide goes out do you discover whose been swimming naked" – Warren Buffett
    • Michael Phelps
    • Katie Ledecky
    • Ian Thorpe


Football

Down..Set..HIKE!

On November 6, 1869, Rutgers and Princeton played what was billed as the first college football game. However, it wasn't until the 1880s that a great rugby player from Yale, Walter Camp, pioneered rules changes that slowly transformed rugby into the new game of American Football.

  • "It's not the SIZE of the dog in the fight, but the size of the FIGHT in the dog." – Archie Griffin
    • Jerry Rice
    • Peyton Manning
    • Drew Brees
